pageProps.content:
![Geumdanggyegok Valley (Í∏àÎãπÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177245_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Geumdanggyegok Valley, located upstream of the Pyeongchanggang River, is a gorge between three different districts of Bongpyeong-myeon, Yongpyeong-myeon and Daehwa-myeon, just west of Geumdangsan Mountain (1,173 m). Geumdanggyegok Valley is an impressive site with sections of both gentle and fast flowing valley waters. From late March through April full-blown azalea covers the mountainsides and valleys providing visitors with a refreshing spring scent.

To reach Geumdanggyegok Valley, travel down along the Pyeongchanggang River from Jangpyeong or trek up the valley from Anmi Elementary School. Coming down to Pyeongchang-eup from Daehwa-myeon area, visitors will encounter an intersection called, ‚ÄúSaechugeori‚Äù. The intersection has two parts Sanganmi and Haanmiri and a sign indicating the Geumdanggyegok Valley entrance. Across the valley, odd-shaped rock formations and cliffs appear one after another along the river. The area is a native habitat for a species of otter (Natural Treasure No. 330) and a favorite spot for catching catfish. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-33-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-330-2771| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Hiking Course:|Geumdanggyegok Valley - Geumdangsan Mountain (1,173 m) (Approx. 1 hr 30 min)| |Tour Course Information:|* Geumdanggyegok Valley - Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village - Heungjeonggyegok Valley - Lee Seungbok Memorial Hall
* Geumdanggyegok Valley - Neounngyegok Valley - Noseongsan Mountain - Gihwagyegok Valley| ## Detail Image ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177173_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177173_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177178_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177178_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177190_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177190_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177193_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177193_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177200_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177200_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177241_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177241_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177244_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177244_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177247_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177247_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177255_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177255_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177238_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-24-1663995422572/1177238_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-330-2771](tel:+82333302771) - [üè†tour.pc.go.kr](http://tour.pc.go.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 37.4824623569 longitude: 128.3942007364 title: 766-2, Geumdanggyegok-ro, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal.
Take an intercity bus bound for Pyeongchang via Jangpyeong.
Get off at Jangpyeong.

From Jangpyeong Terminal, take a bus bound for Yupo-ri.
Bus schedule: 6 times per day/ travel time: 20min.

data.title: Geumdanggyegok Valley (Í∏àÎãπÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)
data.description:
Geumdanggyegok Valley, located upstream of the Pyeongchanggang River, is a gorge between three different districts of Bongpyeong-myeon, Yongpyeong-myeon and Daehwa-myeon, just west of Geumdangsan Mountain (1,173 m). Geumdanggyegok Valley is an impressive site with sections of both gentle and fast flowing valley waters. From late March through April full-blown azalea covers the mountainsides and valleys providing visitors with a refreshing spring scent.

To reach Geumdanggyegok Valley, travel down along the Pyeongchanggang River from Jangpyeong or trek up the valley from Anmi Elementary School. Coming down to Pyeongchang-eup from Daehwa-myeon area, visitors will encounter an intersection called, ‚ÄúSaechugeori‚Äù. The intersection has two parts Sanganmi and Haanmiri and a sign indicating the Geumdanggyegok Valley entrance. Across the valley, odd-shaped rock formations and cliffs appear one after another along the river. The area is a native habitat for a species of otter (Natural Treasure No. 330) and a favorite spot for catching catfish.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: High1 Resort (ÌïòÏù¥Ïõê Î¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏)
dataList.description:
Named to reflect the concept ‚Äúfirst and foremost,‚Äù High1 is a multipurpose leisure resort consisting of High1 Resort, Kangwon Land Convention Hotel, Kangwon Land Casino, High1 Grand Hotel Main Tower, High1 Ski, High1 C.C., High1 Hotel, Valley Condominium, and Mountain Condominium. The ski resort, one of the most popular parts of the High1 complex, offers a 4.2 kilometer-long slope for beginners that runs from the summit of Jijangsan Mountain (altitude 1,345 meters). The ski resort has a total of 18 slopes, 3 gondolas, and 7 lifts.

The two hotels and three condominiums at High1 house a total of 1,577 rooms. Frequented by both Korean and non-Korean travelers, High1 also boasts an 18-hole golf course and Unamjeong, a traditional Korean restaurant. Nearby tourist sites include Jeongseon Rail Bike, Ararichon, Auraji, Gariwangsan Recreational Forest, Jeongseon 5-day Market, Mindungsan Mountain, Donggang River, Jeongseon Sogeumgang River, and Hwaamdonggul Cave.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Heungjeonggyegok Valley (Ìù•Ï†ïÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description: Heungjeonggyegok Valley is about 5 kilometers away from the town of Bongpyeong-myeon in Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do. The 5-kilometer long valley that starts at Heungjeongsan Mountain has a beautiful landscape. A wide variety of freshwater fish like trout inhabit the clear waters of the valley. Heungjonggyegok Valley has become a famous attraction in the Bongpyeong area along with Bongsan Seojae, the shrine of the prominent neo-Confucian scholar Yulgok (1536-1584), and Palseokjeong, featuring the writings of Yang Sa-eon.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Herbnara Farm (ÌóàÎ∏åÎÇòÎùºÎÜçÏõê)
dataList.description: Herbnara Farm opened in 1996 as the first herb-themed farm in Korea. The farm was started in a deep valley in Pyeongchang by a couple whose age added up to 100 years. At that time, the farm was just a small plot of land, but has expanded to the current 33,000 „é° and is one of Pyeongchangs representative tourist attractions. The farm offers ten themed gardens with over 150 herbs such as lavender and sage. Delicious dishes and drinks made with herbs cultivated on the farm are available at the restaurant and cafe. Visitors can also make herbal soap and candles in the herl classroom, and enjoy cultural events throughout the farm.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Haslla Art World (ÌïòÏä¨ÎùºÏïÑÌä∏ÏõîÎìú)
dataList.description: Haslla Art World is an art space that harmonizes nature, people and art. The Sculpture Garden, approximately 27 acres in size, offers various themed gardens and structures. Contemporary Gallery has approximately 200 contemporary artworks, while Pinocchio & Marionette Gallery has various artworks from all over Europe. Haslla Art World has exhibitions and performances throughout the year, providing visitors with a special experience every time they visit.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hanwha Resort Seorak Waterpia (ÌïúÌôîÎ¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏ ÏÑ§ÏïÖ ÏõåÌÑ∞ÌîºÏïÑ)
dataList.description: Located within Seorak Hanwha Resort, nestled at the foot of Seoraksan Mountain and before the deep blue ocean, Seorak Waterpia is a hot springs water theme park that uses 100% pure natural hot springs water.  The park is divided into a spa zone and water zone, with major facilities including an indoor sauna, water play facilities, and a rooftop leisure spa. In particular, the outdoor sauna is quite popular for its view of Seoraksan Mountain. The water throughout the park is kept at a toasty 49 degrees Celsius, making for a fun spa experience year round and fun for the whole family.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hantangang River [National Geopark] (ÌïúÌÉÑÍ∞ï(Íµ≠Í∞ÄÏßÄÏßàÍ≥µÏõê, Í≥†ÏÑùÏ†ï))
dataList.description: Goseok Rock, located in the area of Hantangang River, is a granite rock that reach 15 meters in x_height. The area is often called Goseokjeong, named after the nearby Goseokjeong Pavilion. The area is an important geology and topography learning site where it is visible to see the topography before the formation of the basalt lava field and the fact that the basalt lava flowed over the bedrock to form the lava field. Goseok is a bedrock that existed before the area of Cheorwon was covered with lava, and is a granite formed underground about 110 million years ago (mid Cretaceous period). It is covered in basalt lava by volcanic activity that occurred between about 540,000 and 120,000 years ago, and then eroded by the Hantangang River to form a new waterway.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hani Lavender Farm (ÌïòÎä¨ÎùºÎ≤§ÎçîÌåú)
dataList.description: Hani Lavender Farm was opened on a 33,000 „é° plot of land in 2006 by Ha Deok-ho, the lavender missionary. Mr. Ha originally operated an herb shop in Gyeonggi-do but moved to Goseong to grow his own lavender farm. The area of the farm has the ideal condition for lavender to grow.
dataList.author: korea-tour
